Description: Fragment of Clazomenian black-figure painted pottery broad amphora. Design black and white on red ground, with incised lines and accessories of purple and white. Youth, painted white, riding horse to right. Purple on neck of horse and for ornamental saddlecloth. The horse has pendants from the collar.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (G), chamber 29
Curator's comments: Pl. GB 589, 13 (BM GR 1888.2-8.70.c) is perhaps from the same pot. BMC B.116.2. BSA xlvii, 132-C II.25.
Findspot number '29' is pencilled on the item.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B116.2)
CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 593, 1)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 161)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.211)
